page.title: 10RUMNEY POTTERY I
page.content: ON FRIDAY MAY 3rd,WE VISITED THE POTTERY ON THE BANKS OF THE RHYMNEY RIVER.MR GILES THE POTTER SHOWED US ROUND.THE BUILDING IS VERY OLD AND HAS BEEN A POTTERY FOR 2 OR 3 HUNDRED YEARS.HIS FAMILY HAVE BEEN POTTERS THERE FOR 4 GENERATIONS. NOWADAYS HE WORKS MAINLY WITH MOULDS MAKING COMMEMORATIVE MUGS AND PLATES WITH BRIGHT GLOSSY BLUE,GREEN AND RED BLAZES.HE USED TO USE THE CLAY DUG FROM PITS BESIDE THE RIVER BUT GAVE THIS UP IN 1955.THE LOCAL CLAY IS A RED BROWN COLOUR BUT IS NOT AS GOOD AS THE GREY CLAY MR GILES GETS NOW WHICH COMES FROM STAFFORDSHIRE WHERE IT IS MIXED FROM CLAYS FROM DEVON AND CORNWALL.INSIDE THE BUILDING WE SAW THE OLD BRICK KILN WHICH WAS PARTLY KNOCKED DOWN DURING THE WAR.THERE WERE ALSO REMAINS OF 3 SORTS OF PUG FOR MIXING UP THE CLAY READY FOR WORKING.
